checks.name: Entity Definition Completeness
checks.description: All entities have required fields: @id, name, description, schemaOrgBase, properties
checks.result: 9/9 entities have complete definitions

checks.name: Property Definition Completeness
checks.description: All properties have name, type, required flag, description
checks.result: 127/127 properties have complete definitions

checks.name: Relationship Definition Completeness
checks.description: All relationships have domain, range, cardinality, inverse
checks.result: 16/16 relationships have complete definitions

checks.name: JSON-LD Context Validity
checks.description: JSON-LD context is properly formatted and includes required namespaces
checks.result: Valid context with schema, baiv, xsd, rdfs namespaces

checks.name: Unique Identifiers
checks.description: All entities, relationships, and rules have unique @id values
checks.result: 37 unique identifiers confirmed

checks.name: Schema.org Grounding
checks.description: Entities are properly grounded in schema.org or custom with rationale
checks.result: 8/9 entities use schema.org base types (88.9% alignment)

details.extensionRationale: Custom strategic concepts not present in schema.org

checks.name: Naming Convention Consistency
checks.description: All entities and properties follow consistent naming conventions
checks.result: 100% consistency - PascalCase entities, camelCase properties

checks.name: Relationship Semantics
checks.description: Relationships have clear domain/range and semantic meaning
checks.result: 16/16 relationships semantically valid with documented inverses

checks.name: Type System Consistency
checks.description: Property types are consistent and use standard vocabularies
checks.result: All property types use xsd, schema.org, or defined enumerations

checks.name: Business Rule Coverage
checks.description: Critical business constraints have validation rules
checks.result: 12 business rules defined covering key constraints

checks.name: Rule Severity Classification
checks.description: All rules have appropriate severity levels
checks.result: 6 Error, 5 Warning, 1 Info level rules

checks.name: Rule Testability
checks.description: Business rules are testable with provided test data
checks.result: All 12 rules have test cases in test data set

checks.name: Circular Dependency Prevention
checks.description: Rule BR-006 prevents circular capability dependencies
checks.result: Test data includes invalid case demonstrating detection

checks.name: Test Data Coverage
checks.description: All entities have test instances
checks.result: 47 test instances covering 9 entity types

checks.name: Test Case Distribution
checks.description: Test data includes typical, edge, boundary, and invalid cases
checks.result: 28 typical (60%), 10 edge (21%), 6 boundary (13%), 3 invalid (6%)

checks.name: Relationship Coverage
checks.description: Test data demonstrates all key relationships
checks.result: 16/16 relationships represented in test data

checks.name: Invalid Case Detection
checks.description: Invalid test cases correctly violate business rules
checks.result: 3 invalid cases test BR-006, BR-002, BR-009

checks.name: Real-World Scenarios
checks.description: Test data represents realistic strategic scenarios
checks.result: Test data models realistic consulting firm strategy assessment

checks.name: Glossary Completeness
checks.description: All entities and relationships have glossary entries
checks.result: 25/25 terms documented (9 entities + 16 relationships)

checks.name: Term Definition Quality
checks.description: All terms have comprehensive definitions with examples
checks.result: All terms include: description, usage context, business meaning, technical meaning, AI agent usage

checks.name: Schema.org Mapping Documentation
checks.description: Schema.org equivalents are documented where applicable
checks.result: All terms document schema.org base or extension rationale

checks.name: AI Agent Usage Guidelines
checks.description: Every term includes guidance for AI agent usage
checks.result: 25/25 terms have AI agent usage guidance

checks.name: Query Pattern Documentation
checks.description: Common query patterns are documented with examples
checks.result: 6 query patterns documented with SPARQL examples

checks.name: Reasoning Capability Mapping
checks.description: AI reasoning capabilities are defined with logic
checks.result: 5 reasoning capabilities documented

checks.name: Decision Support Functions
checks.description: Decision support functions defined with inputs/outputs
checks.result: 4 decision support functions documented

checks.name: Integration Points
checks.description: External system integration points are defined
checks.result: 4 integration points documented (BI, PM, Tech Mgmt, Strategic Planning)

checks.name: Entity Reuse Rate
checks.description: Percentage of entities that reuse schema.org
checks.result: 100% (all entities ground in or extend schema.org)

checks.name: Schema.org Alignment
checks.description: Direct usage of schema.org types

checks.name: Documentation Completeness
checks.description: All elements have descriptions

checks.name: Relationship Density
checks.description: Average relationships per entity
checks.result: 1.78 relationships per entity (16 relationships / 9 entities)
checks.note: Appropriate density for strategic domain - not too sparse, not overly complex

checks.name: Naming Convention Compliance
checks.description: Consistent naming across ontology

checks.name: Registry v3.0 Format Compliance
checks.description: Entry follows Registry v3.0 structure
checks.result: Complete registry entry with all required sections

checks.name: Metadata Completeness
checks.description: All registry metadata fields present
checks.result: entryId, entryType, status, version, dates, owner, tags all present

checks.name: Artifact References
checks.description: All artifacts referenced with paths
checks.result: 6 artifacts referenced: ontology, glossary (2), test data, validation, docs

checks.name: Quality Metrics Inclusion
checks.description: Comprehensive quality metrics included
checks.result: Structural, semantic, validation, documentation, AI readiness metrics all present

recommendations.description: Consider adding visual diagrams of entity relationships for stakeholder communication
Implement automated validation tool for business rules beyond manual checks
Consider adding temporal versioning for Capability and Position to track evolution over time

summary.overallAssessment: The AI Strategy Ontology has passed all validation checks and meets all quality thresholds. The ontology is production-ready with comprehensive coverage of strategic concepts, strong schema.org grounding (88.9%), complete documentation, and robust AI/agent readiness. The test data set provides excellent coverage with realistic scenarios. Three optional recommendations are provided for future enhancement.
nextSteps: Complete manual registration in Registry v3.0
Begin using ontology for client engagements and internal strategy
Collect usage feedback for future enhancements
Schedule quarterly review as per governance policy
